contentrichtext.text: {{Japanese name|Yashiki}} {{Expand Japanese|やしきたかじん|date=March 2009}} {{BLP sources|date=January 2011}} {{Nihongo|'''Takajin Yashiki'''|やしきたかじん|Yashiki Takajin}}, often referred to as simply {{nihongo|'''Takajin'''|たかじん}}, (born October 5, 1949) is a singer and television celebrity from [[Nishinari-ku]], [[Osaka]], [[Japan]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sponichi.co.jp/osaka/ente/200902/08/ente217424.html|title=やしきたかじん初メガホン…「映画を撮る」と明言 (Dust or palms have been the first megaphone ... "a film" and stated)|date=February 8,2009|work=[[Sports Nippon]]|language=Japanese|accessdate=14 January 2011}}</ref> In 1970s, he started his singer career in [[Gion]], [[Kyoto]] and he moved to [[Shimokitazawa]], [[Tokyo]] in 1980. In 1981, he sang a theme song of [[Mobile Suit Gundam#Compilation movies|the first movie of the Mobile Suit Gundam]], ''Suna no jujika'' and it was sold 13 thousand CDs. He moved to Osaka in 1982 and has been active mainly in [[Kansai region]] since then. He songs many songs about Osaka such as ''Yappa suki yanen'' (1986), ''Osaka koi monogatari'' (1989), ''Nametonka'' (1990) and ''Tokyo'' (1993). He is popular in Kansai as a frank television presenter, but he does not generally appear nationwide tv shows because he dislikes tv stations in Tokyo. His trademark is sunglasses because of his taste and [[glaucoma]]. ==Programs== ;Present * Takajin Mune Ippai ({{nihongo|[[Kansai Telecasting Corporation|Kansai TV]]|関西テレビ}}) * Takajin No Money ({{nihongo|[[TV Osaka]]|テレビ大阪}}) * Takajin no Sokomade Itte Iinkai ({{nihongo|[[Yomiuri Telecasting Corporation|Yomiuri TV]]|読売テレビ}}) ;Past * Takajin ONE MAN ({{nihongo|[[Mainichi Broadcasting System|MBS]]|毎日放送}}) * Muhaha no Takajin (Kansai TV) == External links == * [http://yashiki-takajin.jp/ Official website] == References == {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Takajin | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Japanese singer | DATE OF BIRTH = October 5, 1949 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Takajin, Yashiki}} [[Category:1949 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Culture in Osaka]] [[Category:Japanese singers]] [[Category:Japanese television personalities]] [[Category:People from Osaka]] [[Category:Japanese racehorse owners and breeders]] {{Japan-musician-stub}}
